Class OrderController

java.lang.Object
app.OrderController
public class OrderController extends Object
Controller class for handling orders in the application. This class handles importing orders into the order table from the customimzation panel and then putting the information into the database when the checkout button is clicked.
Since:
2025-10-20

  • Method Details

    • populateTableView

      public void populateTableView(CashierDrink drink, int quantity)
      Adds a drink to the list.
      Parameters:
      drink - drink to add
      quantity - the amount of times, the drink should be added to the list

    • switchToCashierView

      public void switchToCashierView(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Loads the Cashier view.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the button
      Throws:
      IOException - if new fxml did not load properly

    • cancel

      public void cancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the "Cancel" button click event. Clears the order view table by clearing the list
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the button

    • checkOutButton

      public void checkOutButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Updates the orders into the database. Calls "checkout" function. Clears the list of drinks. Refreshes table view with a "Checkout Successful!" message.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by clicking the button

    • checkout

      public void checkout(javafx.collections.ObservableList<CashierDrink> cart, int employeeID)
      Checks to see if the list is empty. Pushes the order and all of its information into the database if not empty.
      Parameters:
      cart - the list of drinks
      employeeID - unique identifier of the employee
